official-title.#text:
To reform the verification and reporting processes for the health care premium and cost-sharing
			 subsidies.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
Congress finds the following:
Employer reporting requirements under th

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
should strike the appropriate balance between sufficient
			 reporting to enforce the law and protecting the privacy of individuals.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

text.#text:
Protection of the privacy of the primary insured individual and each other individual covered under
			 the policy, which should include minimizing the transmittal of social
			 security numbers, should be a priority when implementing reporting
			 requirements.

header.#text: Use of current year information in determining subsidy eligibility of applicants

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended to read as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1412(b)(2) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1412/ss:b/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide procedures for making advance determinations on the basis of
			 information other than that described in paragraph (1)(B) upon the request
			 of the individual. Such procedures shall include allowing an individual to
			 have eligibility determined on the basis of household income for a later
			 period or on the basis of the individual’s estimate of such income for the
			 taxable year.

text.#text: the extent to which the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the
			 end the following flush sentence:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

quoted-block-continuation-text.#text:
For purposes of subparagraph (B)(i), in the case of an individual other than the primary insured,
			 if the person required to make the return does not collect or maintain
			 information on the TINs of such individuals (other than for purposes of
			 this section), the individual’s name and date of birth may be substituted
			 for the individual’s name and TIN.

text.#text:
The amendment made by this section shall apply to returns the due date for which is after December
			 31, 2013.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following new paragraph:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text:
The statement required to be furnished to any employee under paragraph (1) may be furnished to such
			 employee electronically if such employee has consented to receive such
			 statement electronically. For purposes of the preceding sentence, if an
			 employee has consented, before the date of the enactment of this
			 paragraph, to electronically receive, from the person furnishing such
			 statement, other documents used in filing the employee’s return of tax,
			 such employee shall be treated as having consented to receive such
			 statement electronically unless such employee requests that such consent
			 not apply to such statement.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following new paragraph:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text:
The statement required to be furnished to any individual under paragraph (1) may be furnished to
			 such individual electronically if such individual has consented to receive
			 such statement electronically. For purposes of the preceding sentence, if
			 an individual has consented, before the date of the enactment of this
			 paragraph, to electronically receive, from the person furnishing such
			 statement, other documents containing private health information, such
			 individual shall be treated as having consented to receive such statement
			 electronically unless such individual requests that such consent not apply
			 to such statement.

The amendments made by this section shall apply to statements the due date for which is after
			 December 31, 2013.

header.#text:
Delaying provision of ACA premium and cost-sharing subsidies until eligibility verification process
			 for such subsidies is complete

section 36B of the Internal
			 Revenue Code of 1986

, or the
has been resolved.

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, no premium tax credit under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be
			 allowed with respect to any individual for any coverage month which begins
			 after December 31, 2014, and before the date on which the process to
			 verify, in accordance with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 1402 of the
			 Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1402

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the estimated household income and
			 coverage requirements of such individual for purposes of determining
			 eligibility for, and the accurate amount of, such credit or reduction,
			 respectively, has been completed. For purposes of the previous sentence,
			 the verification process described in such sentence with respect to an
			 individual shall not be treated as complete unless a manual or electronic
			 review has been completed of applicable information required to be
			 submitted by such individual under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 1411 of the Patient Protection and
			 Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1411

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and any inconsistency of such information with records of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1411/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: with respect to an individual for any month—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 5000A of the
			 Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; and

text.#text:
with respect to which such individual would (but for subsection (a)) be allowed a premium tax

which begins after December 31, 2014, and before the date on which the verification process
